About The Kane Center
At the Forefront of "Aging Well"
The Charles and Rae Kane Center is the home of the Council on Aging of Martin County. The Kane Center is specially designed for seniors of all capabilities and walks of life – as well as their families and caregivers – to come together in a secure, comfortable atmosphere where they truly feel at home.
Named for a local couple who have championed senior issues for decades, the $15 million facility was developed through a public/philanthropic partnership, including $5.8 million from public funds, the Florida Legislature and a grant from the Florida Department of Elder Affairs.
The Kane Center is a nine-acre wooded campus located on Salerno Road just east of Kanner Highway. It is less than one mile from Martin Memorial South Hospital, the Robert Morgade branch of the Martin County Library System and the Chastain Campus of IRSC.
The Kane Center is a multi-generational space. Though most services focus on those age 55 and above, many concerts, activities and special events welcome visitors of all ages.
Entrance – Universal design offers accessibility, safety and comfort for all ages and levels of physical ability. The exterior features and expansive, covered porte cochere and covered walkways with protected access to all areas of the building.
Town Center – The Kane Center is the first senior center in Florida to use the innovative Town Center concept reminiscent of small-town America. Boutique store fronts offer an array of services for seniors, their families and their caregivers. Features: Free Wifi, Kane Bistro, Nondenominational chapel, Club Room.
The France Langford Theater & Auditorium – We host a variety of fitness classes, clubs, parties, concerts, luncheons and other special events in our theater. Check the Calendar for our upcoming schedule of events. Visit
www.thekane.org
for information about renting the theater for your event.
The Adult Day Club offers clients a comprehensive array of therapeutic and engaging activities that support their individual needs and enhance their quality of life. The Adult Day Club is a safe, secure and inviting environment to spend the day with features including a dedicated entrance, a bright and spacious indoor area and an outdoor activity space.
Joseph C. & Ann S. Day Medical Center - The Day Medical Center is a full-service primary care practice serving all adults, but particularly those 50 and better. On staff are two internal medicine physicians specialized in gerontology and three nurse practitioners. House calls are available for qualified patients.
Green Building Technology
The Kane Center is certified in the LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) Green Building Rating System by the U.S. Green Building Council and is also the first "green” senior center in Florida that will serves as an emergency shelter.

Login
Become a Member
Care Management
Care Management
The Council on Aging of Martin County's experienced care managers help seniors live independently in their homes for as long as possible by providing access to quality care and assistance with the activities of daily living.
We also provide caregivers with much needed support and respite from the stress of caring for an aged and infirm loved one.
Contact Us
The Council on Aging of Martin County’s private Care Management Services assist seniors (our clients) and caregivers in making smart choices about their health and well-being. Care Managers develop comprehensive care plans customized to the exact needs of the individual then navigate the client and family every step of the way. Care Managers provide ongoing support to ensure clients have everything they need.
Services
Comprehensive in-home assessments
Professional advice about available resources for seniors and their families
Development and implementation of a care plan to improve clients’ health and well-being
Procurement and management of support services such as in-home care and nutrition
Assistance with bill paying and insurance/medical claims processing
Long-term care planning
Caregiver support
Assistance with family dynamics
Cost
Costs for care management services will vary depending upon the type and frequency of services required; this is determined at the time of the assessment.
We accept payment from the following: Veterans' Benefits, the Medicare Long-Term Care program or programs funded by the Area Agency on Aging, and Martin County Aids and Grants. We also accept private pay and donations. Financial assistance is available for qualifying seniors. The payment option is determined through the interview and intake process.
Senior Services Navigator
A Senior Services Navigator is available at the Kane Center for walk-ins and callers seeking assistance about senior-related issues and resources.
Get help with referrals for community-based services, financial assistance, and placement on the waiting list for government-funded services.
Access Council on Aging programs like Meals on Wheels, case management, adult day services and senior-focused primary care.
Available to offer support and guidance to stabilize and/or diffuse crisis situations.
Brian Sullivan
bsullivan@coamartin.org
772.223.7856

Thank you for visiting The Martin County Council on Aging's website. We invite you to contact us to learn more about how we can assist your elder loved one or answer general questions for you about senior resources and care.
Feel free to contact us via telephone or by using the convenient form below. We will respond to your request promptly.

Stuart, Florida  34997

Login
Become a Member
Become a Member
Don't Miss A Minute!
Enjoy Life. Be Well. Stay Active. Find it all at the Kane Center.
There's a lot happening at the Kane Center, and you won't want to miss a minute of it! Our year-round activity schedule features classes, clubs, concerts, special events and more. All programs are designed for active seniors age 55 or better – with family and friends welcome to join in.
While you don't need to be a member to enjoy Kane Center activities, becoming a member has its perks! Kane members receive discounts on everything from classes and concert tickets to purchases at the Kane Bistro.  Once ordered, membership cards will be mailed within 5 business days.
For questions about membership, please call 772.223.7800.
Comprehensive services from the Kane Center were made possible by an additional $150,000 contribution by the
Joseph C. Day Foundation
, which represents part of a total commitment of $500,000 to support the Council on Aging of Martin County.
Memberships
Kane Member
$60
/year
Discount on all fitness classes
One free fitness class per year
Access to counseling services with a licensed clinical social worker
Free Healthly Living lectures
Discounts on most Kane live entertainment & special events
Discounts on Lifelong Learning and workshops
Unlimited participation in Kane Games & Groups
Free Education lectures
Day Trips to historical sites and other places of interest
Access to free member events
10% discount on Kane Center venue rental (discount on room fee only)
5 free Kane Cuisine meals (can be donated to seniors in need)
